content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Northern Gulf Institute (MSU-04)</origin> <pubdate>2008</pubdate> <title>Bathymetric Data for Aberdeen Pool, Tenn-Tom Waterway in Mississippi for Water and Quality Calculations in 2008: Filename: Northern Gulf Institute</title> <geoform>spreadsheet</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Northern Gulf Institute at Mississippi State University</pubplace> <publish>Northern Gulf Institute</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>http://sulis-data.ngi.msstate.edu/geoportal/catalog/search/search.page</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>Aberdeen Pool on the Tennessee-Tombigbee Waterway is a dynamic system that suffers from sedimentation problems.  This problem inhibits tow and pleasure craft travel along the main channel. Bathymetric (depth) data were collected to use in sediment budget calculations and numerical model setup.</abstract> <purpose>The collection of bathymetry data will aid in more accurately modeling where sedimentation problems will occur.</purpose> <supplinf>The US Army Corps of Engineers has detailed channel bathymetry, but no recent data of the rest of the pool.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>200707</begdate> <enddate>200806</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <current>ground condition</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>In work</progress> <update>Irregular</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-88.552988</westbc> <eastbc>-88.504320</eastbc> <northbc>34.002872</northbc> <southbc>33.815343</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>None</themekt> <themekey>Bathymetric</themekey> <themekey>Hydrographic</themekey> <themekey>Survey</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115</themekt> <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>None</placekt> <placekey>Aberdeen Pool</placekey> </place> <stratum> <stratkt>None</stratkt> <stratkey>Aberdeen Dam</stratkey> </stratum> </keywords> <accconst>None</accconst> <useconst>These data should not be used for navigation purposes.</useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>Northern Gulf Institute</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>mailing and physical</addrtype> <address>NGI Program Office</address> <address>MSU Science and Technology Center</address> <address>1021 Balch Blvd.</address> <city>Stennis Space Center</city> <state>MS</state> <postal>39529</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>662.688.4218</cntvoice> <cntemail>program.office@ngi.msstate.edu</cntemail> <hours>8:00 AM - 5:00 PM</hours> <cntinst>Monday-Friday</cntinst> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <datacred>Mississippi State University</datacred> <native>Original data are logged in a Lowrance format.  The Lowrance Sonar Log Viewer allows the user to upload the data in a spreadsheet format such as Microsoft Excel.</native> </idinfo> <spdoinfo> <direct>Point</direct> <ptvctinf> <sdtsterm>
